integer function solve(K)
  integer, intent(in) :: K
  integer:: temp_K, ans, remainder

  temp_K = K
  if ( mod(temp_K, 2) ==0 .or. mod(temp_K,5) ==0 ) then
     solve = -1
     return
  end if

  if ( mod(temp_K,7) ==0 ) then
     temp_K = temp_K/7
  end if
  temp_K = temp_K *9 ! multiply by9.

  ans =1
  remainder = mod(10, temp_K)
  do while ( remainder /= 1 )
    ans = ans +1
    remainder = mod( remainder *10, temp_K )
  end do

  solve = ans
end function

children.text:
Now, translating the function:

Now, putting this together into a complete program. First, the program structure:

program main

implicit none
integer :: K, result

read(*,*) K
result = solve(K)
write(*,*) result

contains
  FUNCTION solve(K) result (ans_out)
    integer, intent(in) :: K
    integer :: temp_K, ans, remainder, ans_out

    temp_K = K
    if (mod(temp_K, 2) == 0 .or. mod(temp_K,5) ==0) then
      ans_out = -1
      return
    end if

    if (mod(temp_K,7) ==0) then
      temp_K = temp_K /7
    end if
    temp_K = temp_K *9  ! multiply by 9

    ans =1
    remainder = mod(10, temp_K)  ! 10 mod temp_K
    do while (remainder /=1 )
      ans = ans +1  
      remainder = mod( remainder *10, temp_K )
    end do
    ans_out = ans
  ENDFUNCTION solve

end program

Wait, but in the function, the 'contains' block is inside the main program.

children.text:
Testing: writing the function correctly. In code:

program atcoder_abc174_c
  implicit none
  integer :: K, ans

  read(*, *) K
  ans = solve(K)
  print *, ans
contains
  integer function solve(K)
    implicit none
    integer, intent(in) :: K
    integer :: temp_K, remainder, temp_ans

    temp_K = K
    ! Check if divisible by 2 or 5
    if (mod(temp_K, 2) == 0 .or. mod(temp_K, 5) == 0) then
      solve = -1
      return
    end if

    ! Check divisibility by 7
    if (mod(temp_K, 7) == 0) then
      temp_K = temp_K / 7
    end if
    temp_K = temp_K * 9

    temp_ans = 1
    remainder = mod(10, temp_K)

    do while (remainder /= 1)
      temp_ans = temp_ans + 1
      remainder = mod(remainder * 10, temp_K)
    end do

    solve = temp_ans
  end function solve
end program atcoder_abc174_c

integer function solve(K)
  integer, intent(in) :: K
  integer:: temp_K, ans, remainder

  temp_K = K
  if ( mod(temp_K, 2) ==0 .or. mod(temp_K,5) ==0 ) then
     solve = -1
     return
  end if

  if ( mod(temp_K,7) ==0 ) then
     temp_K = temp_K/7
  end if
  temp_K = temp_K *9 ! multiply by9.

  ans =1
  remainder = mod(10, temp_K)
  do while ( remainder /= 1 )
    ans = ans +1
    remainder = mod( remainder *10, temp_K )
  end do

  solve = ans
end function

program main

implicit none
integer :: K, result

read(*,*) K
result = solve(K)
write(*,*) result

contains
  FUNCTION solve(K) result (ans_out)
    integer, intent(in) :: K
    integer :: temp_K, ans, remainder, ans_out

    temp_K = K
    if (mod(temp_K, 2) == 0 .or. mod(temp_K,5) ==0) then
      ans_out = -1
      return
    end if

    if (mod(temp_K,7) ==0) then
      temp_K = temp_K /7
    end if
    temp_K = temp_K *9  ! multiply by 9

    ans =1
    remainder = mod(10, temp_K)  !10 mod temp_K
    do while (remainder /=1 )
      ans = ans +1  
      remainder = mod( remainder *10, temp_K )
    end do
    ans_out = ans
  ENDFUNCTION solve

end program

Testing: writing the function correctly.

In code:

program atcoder_abc174_c
  implicit none
  integer :: K, ans

  read(*, *) K
  ans = solve(K)
  print *, ans
contains
  integer function solve(K)
    implicit none
    integer, intent(in) :: K
    integer :: temp_K, remainder, temp_ans

    temp_K = K
    ! Check if divisible by 2 or 5
    if (mod(temp_K, 2) == 0 .or. mod(temp_K, 5) == 0) then
      solve = -1
      return
    end if

    ! Check divisibility by 7
    if (mod(temp_K, 7) == 0) then
      temp_K = temp_K / 7
    end if
    temp_K = temp_K * 9

    temp_ans = 1
    remainder = mod(10, temp_K)

    do while (remainder /= 1)
      temp_ans = temp_ans + 1
      remainder = mod(remainder * 10, temp_K)
    end do

    solve = temp_ans
  end function solve
end program atcoder_abc174_c

This should be the complete Fortran code.

Wait in the above code, 'temp_ans' and 'remainder' are declared as integers in the solve function.
